subject: Critical Thinking
title: Status Quo Bias: The Devil You Know
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Status Quo Bias: The Devil You Know.

hook.text: When organ donation is opt-in, participation is ~15%. When it's opt-out, it's ~90%. Same choice. Different default.

buildup.text: Status quo bias: people overwhelmingly prefer the current state of affairs, even when change is objectively better.

discovery.text: It combines loss aversion (change risks loss), endowment effect (we overvalue what we have), and effort avoidance.

twist.text: Governments and companies weaponize this. Auto-enrolled subscriptions, pre-checked boxes â€” defaults control behavior.

climax.text: The most powerful policy tool isn't incentives or laws â€” it's choosing what the default option is.

punchline.text: The default wins. Whoever sets it controls the outcome.

quiz.question: Why does organ donation skyrocket when it's opt-out instead of opt-in?
options: Status quo bias makes people stick with the default
Opt-out forms are easier to read
